value: A Votive Image of a Boy Presented by his Parents to St. Nicholas of Bari

label: Description
value: The Saint is sitting on clouds, with book and three balls, blessing.  Surrounded by angels, two of them with mitre and crozier.  Below, at left:  The father standing, mother and son kneeling.  At right a tub surrounded by three children.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and brown and gray wash, pen and brown ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: From the collection of Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund

label: Description
value:
Recto:  Vertical composition framed by a thick line of pen and black ink in the shape of a tombstone with concave corners.  Depicted is angel supporting the collapsing saint.  One points at an open book in the foreground at right.  In the foreground at left are the upper parts of a Demon and of a woman chained to a stone wall.  In the background at right is the Purgatory, with an angel liberating a soul.  The composition has been squared in graphite.  
Verso: Above is a head, shown in profile; outlined.  Below folded hands.  Written below: "Mergolo" (erased) 1776/Egreg[ia] (erased) S[ignor]a E...

label: Physical description
value: Brush and brown ink with gray wash; verso: pen and brown ink with black chalk on off-white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward Brandegee

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund

label: Description
value: The woman, soldiers, and two disciples at left, Christ with others at right.  He points at the words He has written.  The woman rather undisturbed.

Stage Design, Interior of Oriental Building

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Interior of building in Islamic style with enormous vaults and rich decoration. In foreground, two pedestals each with two sculptures of lions, benches and tables. Two male figures in center foreground, one kneeling and holding the hand of the other figure, who stands facing forward.

Project for a Painted Square Ceiling

label: Description
value: Heracles fights the Nemean lion. Decorative motifs include rinceaux, decagons, garlands, and sphinxes.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, watercolor over graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
Ceiling in Hadrian's Villa, near Tivoli

label: Description
value: Design of a ceiling.  One quarter of the design is shown.  In the center is a tent cupola shown from below.  It is supported at four corners by bucrania and in the middle of the curved sides by winged female half-figures, who are on top of an arch which is supported by two satyr gaines.  In the center of the cupola is a panel with a sphere supported by four children.  A few grotesque motifs are in the remaining panels.  From the bucrania hang festoons, the other ends of which are held by women who stand near the geines.  Below the bucrania are sitting figures of gods; shown are Zeus and Ares.  Outside are framing panels of different shapes.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, gold paint, black chalk on paper

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee

label: Credit line

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle showing a palace façade and loggia surmounted with balustrade. In the background, an obelisk is capped with a "mountain and star”, the Albani arms. Lined and ruled border.

Stage Design, Apollo with Famous Men and Muses

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Apollo in front of temple portico surrounded by Muses and famous men, identified by inscriptions on the stairs below which they are standing. Men include Homer, Dante, Alfieri, Virgilio, and others.

Design for the organ case of S. Gregorio in Bologna

label: Description
value: Embeded and fluted Ionic columns rise from brackets and support the entablature and a triangular pediment. A high central arch and low lateral ones show an ornament as a buttress.

Stage Setting, People Rushing into Crypt

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Slight indication of vaults in interior space. Fire burning at center, several figures rushing in from left with lit torches. Skeleton in the foreground at right, possibly representing Death. Verso: Skull and skeleton.

Study for a Tribute to Giorgio Vasari

label: Description
value: Minerva dictating to Story, who writes "I STUR[ia]" in a book which the kneeling Saturnus holds on his black.  A genius with two trumpets flies above.  The setting is in a hall with a painter sitting upon a scaffolding and painting a fresco.  Reverse:  pen and chalk sketches of a man climbing a ladder and carrying a package on his head.  Chalk outline of coffers of a ceiling.
